title: No One Knows
body:
Living with anxiety and depression is...difficult.

Not in the sense of dealing with i, but that I don't deal with it.

I act as normal as I can in front of my family. Like I'm some well adjusted person who doesn't let the worries of the world bother my flow... well all I can say to them is 'fuck you'...but of course I won't say it. I'm the kind little brother after all. And they're family.

In my house, I need to be the adult, even if I'm the youngest of four siblings. I HAVE to be the adult!

It's not a matter of "they are all useless bums" it's more of "I have to be their support". The thing about my family that makes it "unique" is, without me, it's just one bad day away from my siblibgs killing each other like some wild animal.

I'm treated as kindly as a little brother can be treated, even if I'm already 23 years old...or 24? I don't know. I stopped counting my age when I dropped out from college because of my chosen reason of "our family is financially troubled" and not because I was secretly hiding the fact that my depression made me unable to catch up with my studies. It's better that way rather than letting them know that I'm in need of expensive antidepressants. I already need to take heart pills, I don't want another batch of money draining pills being the reason why we're hardly getting by.

Whenever I have one of my episodes, I just lock myself in my room, so that they can't see the pathetic image of me curling my legs, trying to not let a single sound come out of me because my mentally is torturing like I'm some sort animal. I can't even cut myself because they'll know so I just substitute it by beating myself in places where they won't seei the bruises.

It helps that I'm a quiet guy, they will think that all I do in my room reading on my phone like I usually do.

Everyone in my house has their own problems, why should I add myself on that list?

...Nobody knows about the many times that I just stayed awake watching youtube videos in order to avoid being left with my thoughts.

How every time I hold on to a kitchen knife, the image of stabbing myself or cutting myself passes by.

How some nights I'm forced to vomit nothing because the stress literally makes my stomach ache.

Nobody knows because I'm VERY good at keeping it hidden.

All I want is.

I...I just want have quiet.

The kind of quiet when my own brain isn't screaming at me for being a failure.

The kind of quiet that makes looking in the mirror easy.

The kind of quiet where I don't see that kid just staring at me from the crack of my closet.

I talk to my friends about jokingly having depression, we laugh it off like we always do. They're good friends....They're good friends.

No one knows that I have depression or anxiety. I don't take pills. I don't go to a therapist. I don't use an outlet to release that stress. NO. ONE. KNOWS. I. HAVE. IT.

And I plan to keep it that way.

But they will know. They. Will. Know.

I already brought a rope in my room, all that's left is to learn how to tie a noose.

Hopefully, that kid won't stop me like last time.
author: Layzay_Mask
